PathInterpolator(float, float, float, fl.Description: Create an interpolator for a cubic Bezier curve. The end points (0, 0) and (1, 1) are assumed.

Returns: The y coordinate of the Path along the line where x = t.
Parameters: float: Treated as the x coordinate along the line.
getInterpolation(float).Description: Using the line in the Path in this interpolator that can be described as y = f(x), finds the y coordinate of the line given t as the x coordinate. Values less than 0 will always return 0 and values greater than 1 will always return 1.

Parameters: Path: The Path to use to make the line representing the interpolator.
PathInterpolator(android.graphics.Path).Description: Create an interpolator for an arbitrary Path. The Path must begin at (0, 0) and end at (1, 1).

Parameters: float: The x coordinate of the quadratic Bezier control point.
float: The y coordinate of the quadratic Bezier control point.
PathInterpolator(float,float).Description: Create an interpolator for a quadratic Bezier curve. The end points (0, 0) and (1, 1) are assumed.

Parameters: float: The x coordinate of the quadratic Bezier control point.
float: The y coordinate of the quadratic Bezier control point.
PathInterpolator(float, float).Description: Create an interpolator for a quadratic Bezier curve. The end points (0, 0) and (1, 1) are assumed.

ClassDesc: An interpolator that can traverse a Path that extends from Point (0, 0) to (1, 1). The x coordinate along the Path is the input value and the output is the y coordinate of the line at that point. This means that the Path must conform to a function y = f(x). The Path must not have gaps in the x direction and must not loop back on itself such that there can be two points sharing the same x coordinate. It is alright to have a disjoint line in the vertical direction:
